title: PhysicalSampleRecord
description: This is a data object that is a digital representation of a physical sample

schema.description: identifier for the JSON schema for validation purposes

id.description: URI that identifies this sample description record (not the physical sample itself

label.description: string that will identify the sample for human users; typically an identifier assigned by teh original collector; other names can be included in the alternateNames array property.

sampleIdentifier.description: unique identifier for the physical object, ideally a URI that is physically attached to the specimen object, typically an IGSN or ARK with current iSamplePartners.

description.description: free text description of the physical sample, and any related information. Include as much detail as will be useful for users to find the sample and understand its context.

hasContextCategory.description: top level context, based on the kind of feature sampled, from the SampledFeature vocabulary.  Specific identification of the sampled feature of interest is done through the SamplingEvent/Feature of Interest property.

hasMaterialCategory.description: specify the kind of material that constitutes the sample

hasSpecimenCategory.description: specify the kind of object that the specimen is

keywords.description: free text categorization of sample to support discovery

producedBy.description: object that documents the sampling event--who, where, when the specimen was obtained

registrant.description: identification of the agent that registered the sample, with contact information. Should include person name and affiliation, or position name and affiliation, or just organization name. e-mail address is preferred contact information.

samplingPurpose.description: term to specify why a sample was collection.

informalClassification.description: free text classification terms, not from a controlled vocabulary; generally terms applied by collector

relatedResource.description: link to related resource with relationship property to indicate nature of connection. Target should be identifier for a resource.

GeospatialDDCoordLocation.title: GeospatialDDCoordLocation
GeospatialDDCoordLocation.description: specification of WGS84 decimal degree location of sampling location; could be sample point location, or the centroid of a sampling area

elevation.description: should be a number and Unit of measure, and the datum. e.g. 401 m above mean sea level.

latitude.description: angular coordinate measured positive north from the equator.

longitude.description: angular coordinate measured positive eastward from the prime meridian.

SamplingEvent.description: object that documents the sampling event--who, where, when the specimen was obtained

label.description: a human intelligible string used to uniquely identify the sampling event.

description.description: free text description of the sampling event

responsibility.description: String with person name and affiliation, or organization name, and their role relative to the parent element.

resultTime.description: Date on which the sample was collected.

samplingSite.description: object that identifies the place where the sample was collected

SamplingEvent.title: SamplingEvent

SamplingSite.description: documentation of the site where the sample was collected, wtih place name(s) and a geospatial location

description.description: free text description of the subject of a triple.

label.description: a human intelligible string used to identify a thing, i.e. the name to use for the thing; should be unique in the scope of a sample collection or dataset.

location.description: geopatial location of site; required default is WGS84 latitude, longitude in decimal degrees. Elevation as a string with number, unit of measure, and datum.

placeName.description: one or more names by which the sampling site is known.

SamplingSite.title: SamplingSite

SampleRelation.description: semantic link to other samples or related resources.

description.description: free text description of the subject of a triple.

label.description: a human intelligible string used to identify a thing, i.e. the name to use for the thing; should be unique in the scope of a sample collection or dataset.

relationshipType.description: term to identify realationship between host sample and the sample relation target. Should be controlled vocabulary (ScopedName). For now start with string, 'derivedFrom'.

target.description: identifier for the target resource in the relationship. Start with string, should be Identifier object.

SampleRelation.title: SampleRelation

Curation.description: object contains information about current storage of sample, access to sample, and events in curation history. Curation as used here starts when the sample is removed from its original context, and might include various processing steps for preservation.  Processing related to analysis preparation such as crushing, dissolution, evaporation, filtering are considered part of the sampling method for the derived child sample. Use to represent chain of custody; new Curation object created when location changes; updates to accessConstraints or responsibilities should be noted as events.

label.description: a human intelligible string used to identify the curation event.

description.description: free text information about curation. Include narrative of curation events here untill Events get added to the model

accessConstraints.description: cultural, legal or other policy issues that bear on access to view, borrow, or subsample a sample or visit a sampling site.

curationLocation.description: information about where and how the sample is currently stored

responsibility.description: String with person name and affiliation, or organization name, and their role relative to the parent element.

Curation.title: Curation
